page.title: 04HOUSING IN CHADDESLEYCORBETT
page.content: The main street in Chaddesley Corbett has not changed much in the last 300 years. The original line of houses is still there with the houses standing on plots of land that are drawn in early maps. Over the years additional houses have been built by the local authority and by private builders. The old school and workhouse have been converted into flats. Some houses are owner occupied and some rented. There is very good provision for old people, in the alms houses and council bungalows, with a resident Warden on call to look after them. There are some families with school aged children but many tenants and home owners are middle aged and elderly. Properties are highly priced as Chaddesley Corbett is a prestigious village.
